page.title: 11Friday Bridge School
page.content: Friday Bridge had 2 schools but there is now only one. The original National School was opened in 1872 & cost of Â£886. Children of all ages attended the school until 1928 when children over ten were transferred to the new school. The children had to use outside toilets that contained buckets. In winter they could not have PE because they didn't have a hall to do it in. The children had different holidays to us. They had two weeks off for strawberry picking and two weeks off for potato picking. The old school closed in 1958. The present school was opened in 1928 as a secondary modern school but in 1958 the secondary children were transferred to the Queen's school in Wisbech. The school re-opened in 1973 additions include: hall, classroom, swimming pool. Today the school contains 109 pupils.
